question: 弦
sourceAnswer:
<read>つる</read>:: bowstring | string-(of-shamisen,-guitar,-violin,-etc.) | bail-(arched-pot-handle) | diagonal-levelling-wire-across-the-top-of-a-masu
<read>げん</read>:: bowstring | string-(of-a-shamisen,-etc.)/stringed-instrument | chord | hypotenuse
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word is made up of a single kanji, it probably uses the kun'yomi reading. You did not learn this reading, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

Snap all the <vocabulary>bowstring</vocabulary>s! Now none of the musicians can play their instruments. "You're <reading>too ru</reading>de (<ja>つる</ja>)!" they yell, as they cry over the snapped bowstrings. They aren't wrong, that was just too rude of you.
